🚀 Elevate your teaching with the power of Two-way Learning! ✨ We're excited to invite primary and secondary educators from ACT and surrounds to join proud Murran/ Bunitj Woman, Tegan Cross (nee Christophersen) and the Questacon Educator Programs Team for a FREE hands-on workshop that connects STEM and the Australian curriculum to Indigenous knowledge systems. Using traditional weaving techniques as an entry point, this session will introduce you to practical strategies and tools to bring a fresh perspective to your classroom, no matter your teaching area. Engage with fellow educators, broaden your teaching toolkit, and start your journey toward a richer, more inclusive classroom experience. 📅 Date: Friday, September 20 2024 📍 Location: Questacon - National Science and Technology Centre 🔗 Register Now: https://bit.ly/4gaGE6K Join us in embracing a pedagogy that honours the depth of Indigenous knowledge while advancing STEM education. For more information, reach out to our team at teachers@questacon.edu.au. #STEMEducation #IndigenousKnowledge #TwoWayLearning #ProfessionalDevelopment

🌟 Attention South Australia! We’re thrilled to bring the Questacon STEM Futures program to your region! 🌏 Our mission? To collaborate with educators, school leaders, and local communities in building a strong, sustainable STEM Learning Ecosystem. Through a blend of in-person events, virtual workshops, and continuous support, we’ll work together to cultivate a culture of STEM that empowers every student at your school. This program is especially designed for underserved schools and communities, providing access to national experts, industry partners, and free resources to drive meaningful change in STEM education. 📚 Join us as we kick off this exciting initiative and take the first step towards transforming STEM learning in South Australia! Learn more about the program - register your interest or attend an online information session: https://bit.ly/3MhkfqE. Reach out to our team at teachers@questacon.edu.au for more information. #QuestaconSTEMFutures #STEMLeadership #EducationInnovation #SouthAustralia

Get charged up with science at ‘Atomically Correct’ the award-winning comedy show by Rachel Rayner, Science Explainer, on Thursday 14 August. Fresh from Adelaide Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival, tickets are on sale now for two shows only at 5.30pm and 7.30pm. The 7.30pm show will have an Auslan Interpreter. This show is suitable for audiences 15 years+. We're positive it's a perfect date night for the atomically curious friend in your life. Book your tickets at http://spklr.io/6045s3Kz

🌍🏠 Exciting News: Earthquake House is BACK! 🌟 We are thrilled to announce the return of Earthquake House.🚀🔬 This iconic exhibit has been a cornerstone of our educational offerings at the Centre since 1988, and now it’s back with 'groundbreaking' new science and technology. In collaboration with Geoscience Australia and Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC), we have reimagined Earthquake House to provide an immersive and educational experience. Geoscience Australia’s National Earthquake Alerts Centre provided crucial technical support to Earthquake House, providing valuable input to modelling hypothetical earthquakes and replaying real seismic events. Using state-of-the-art special effects to replicate the sensations of a seismic event near Canberra, our team has integrated more than 30 advanced practical and audiovisual effects to this exhibit. 🌋📚 We are proud to continue our tradition of innovation and education, making Earthquake House a standout feature in our Awesome Earth gallery. The exhibit is included with general admission, and we invite you to experience this seismic adventure as part of your visit. We look forward to welcoming you for a unique and educational experience!

We’re thrilled to announce that our Engineering is Elementary team is on the move again for Term 3! 🚗✨ After an incredible Term 2 in QLD and WA, we are excited to bring our FREE professional learning workshops for teachers to NT, SA, and online this August and September. These workshops are designed to enhance teachers' skills, build confidence in teaching STEM, and provide a fantastic opportunity to connect with fellow educators. Join us to explore innovative teaching strategies, engage in hands-on activities, and discover new ways to inspire your students in STEM. Don’t miss out on this chance to elevate your teaching practice and be part of a supportive community of passionate educators. Register here: https://bit.ly/4d2LSio Secure your spot today and be ready for a transformative experience that will empower you to make a significant impact in your classroom. 🌟📚 #EiEAustralia #ProfessionalDevelopment #STEMEducation #TeacherWorkshops

This NAIDOC week, we're inviting our visitors to join in some fun animal tracking activities in QLab. Together, we're exploring how First Nations people use symbols to share knowledge. More info: https://lnkd.in/gBRE2kKk. We also have heaps of fun activities celebrating First Nations knowledge online: https://lnkd.in/guBd6yZg. The 2024 NAIDOC week theme is ‘Keep the fire burning! Blak, Loud and Proud!’. We recognise the enduring strength of First Nations communities and celebrate First Nations identity. Read more: https://lnkd.in/gtb3Y8ba

🌟 Celebrating International Day of Women in Engineering! 🌟 Let's weave some fun into this day by spotlighting the incredible contributions of women in engineering who have shaped our world in extraordinary ways. Their innovations have truly been #EnhancedByEngineering.👩🔬 Did you know, textile engineering merges science, technology, engineering and mathematics to create everything from clothing to industrial fabrics. First Nations women and people have long been pioneers in this field, using natural and renewable materials to weave baskets, fish traps, and more—skills passed down through generations. 🌱🐟 From crafting string-strong textiles to knotting intricate designs, First Nations women and people have been the thread that ties innovation with tradition. Their weaving wonders—from baskets to biofabrics—showcase a seamless blend of STEM, culture, and sustainability. 💚 At Questacon, we aim to inspire educators to spark STEM curiosity in the classroom through our educator programs, connecting them with opportunities to engage with country through STEM. Learn more about it here: https://bit.ly/3xhjyd7. Be sure to watch this space for a NEW unit from our Engineering is Elementary program on Textile Engineering 👀 Join us in celebrating these loom-inous ladies and all women engineers who keep the world stitched together with their brilliance! 🧶✨

Nine of Questacon’s wonderful science communicators have made the trip to Perth for the Australian Science Communicators conference. The Questacon team is soaking up the opportunity to connect with a range of science communication experts and practitioners. This enriching experience with a broad community of science writers, policy informers and research experts is bound to inspire new ideas and ways of working. We are looking forward to hearing their stories. Make sure to say hello if you see one of our friendly Questacon team 👋
